e5: I would view an ethical reporting policy as one that is transparent, honest and not misleading to stakeholders. In this context, the policy explicitly discloses expectations, rather than deliberately manipulating earnings-per-share (EPS) data to create a certain image or gain competitive advantage. Key principles include: avoiding intentional manipulations of financial metrics; clearly disclosing any adjustments used in reporting accounting figures; maintaining consistency between the information provided and management intentions; preventing situations in which specific clients are exposed unduly; protecting retail investors not directly cognizant as being well aware in advance about this 10 percent underreporting bias.
